summary: This is a letter from attorneys Michael C. Miller and Martin G. Weinberg, representing the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter formally requests specific documents and records from the Department of Justice related to Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, citing serious irregularities and the need for their own investigation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York at approximately 6:30 a.m. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead.

events.title: AG Barr Comments on Irregularities
events.description: Attorney General William Barr stated publicly that authorities were 'learning of serious irregularities' at the MCC facility that demanded a thorough investigation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on the morning of August 10, 2019, while awaiting trial on federal charges.
The Federal Bureau of Prisons stated Epstein was found unresponsive from an 'apparent suicide,' and the FBI was investigating the incident.
Attorney General William Barr publicly stated there were 'serious irregularities' at the MCC that demanded a thorough investigation.

Attorneys for Epstein's estate are formally requesting specific evidence from the DOJ, including video recordings, entry/exit logs, guard logs, and death investigation protocols from August 9-10, 2019, to conduct their own investigation.
The New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner initially declined to immediately release a determination on the cause and manner of death, citing a need for 'further information.'
